intro: Lepanthes vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces intricate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Lepanthes vargasii is part of the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its sympodial growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
